trans-unit.source: Get Started with authentication in Mobile Services for Xamarin iOS apps | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get Started with authentication in Mobile Services for Xamarin iOS apps | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your Xamarin iOS app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your Xamarin iOS app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Mobile Services app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Mobile Services app

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]This is an Azure Mobile Services topic.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]This is an Azure Mobile Services topic.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure recommends Azure App Service Mobile Apps for all new mobile backend deployments.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure recommends Azure App Service Mobile Apps for all new mobile backend deployments.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [equivalent tutorial in Mobile Apps documentation](../app-service-mobile/app-service-mobile-xamarin-ios-get-started-users.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [equivalent tutorial in Mobile Apps documentation](../app-service-mobile/app-service-mobile-xamarin-ios-get-started-users.md).

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Mobile Services from your app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Mobile Services from your app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable authentication in your app:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable authentication in your app:

trans-unit.source: [Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services]
trans-unit.target: [Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services]

trans-unit.source: [Restrict table permissions to authenticated users]
trans-unit.target: [Restrict table permissions to authenticated users]

trans-unit.source: [Add authentication to the app]
trans-unit.target: [Add authentication to the app]

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: 6.
trans-unit.target: 6.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, run the client project on a device or simulator.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, run the client project on a device or simulator.

trans-unit.source: Verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: Verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the *TodoItem* table now requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the *TodoItem* table now requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to the app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to the app

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will modify the app to display a login screen before displaying data.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will modify the app to display a login screen before displaying data.

trans-unit.source: When the app starts, it will not connect to your mobile service and will not display any data.
trans-unit.target: When the app starts, it will not connect to your mobile service and will not display any data.

trans-unit.source: After the first time that the user performs the refresh gesture, the login screen will appear; after successful login the list of todo items will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: After the first time that the user performs the refresh gesture, the login screen will appear; after successful login the list of todo items will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: In the client project, open the file **QSTodoService.cs** and add the following declarations to QSTodoService:
trans-unit.target: In the client project, open the file **QSTodoService.cs** and add the following declarations to QSTodoService:

trans-unit.source: Add a new method **Authenticate** to **QSTodoService** with the following definition:
trans-unit.target: Add a new method **Authenticate** to **QSTodoService** with the following definition:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When you use an identity provider other than a Facebook, change the value passed to **LoginAsync** above to one of the following: _MicrosoftAccount_, _Twitter_, _Google_, or _WindowsAzureActiveDirectory_.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When you use an identity provider other than a Facebook, change the value passed to **LoginAsync** above to one of the following: _MicrosoftAccount_, _Twitter_, _Google_, or _WindowsAzureActiveDirectory_.

trans-unit.source: Open **QSTodoListViewController.cs** and modify the method definition of **ViewDidLoad** to remove or comment-out the call to **RefreshAsync()** near the end.
trans-unit.target: Open **QSTodoListViewController.cs** and modify the method definition of **ViewDidLoad** to remove or comment-out the call to **RefreshAsync()** near the end.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code at the top of the **RefreshAsync** method definition:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code at the top of the **RefreshAsync** method definition:

trans-unit.source: This displays a sign-in screen to attempt authentication when the **User** property is null.
trans-unit.target: This displays a sign-in screen to attempt authentication when the **User** property is null.

trans-unit.source: When the login is successful the **User** is set.
trans-unit.target: When the login is successful the **User** is set.

trans-unit.source: Press the **Run** button to build the project and start the app in the iPhone simulator.
trans-unit.target: Press the **Run** button to build the project and start the app in the iPhone simulator.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the app displays no data.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the app displays no data.

trans-unit.source: **RefreshAsync()** has not yet been called.
trans-unit.target: **RefreshAsync()** has not yet been called.

trans-unit.source: Perform the refresh gesture by pulling down the list of items, which calls **RefreshAsync()**.
trans-unit.target: Perform the refresh gesture by pulling down the list of items, which calls **RefreshAsync()**.

trans-unit.source: This calls **Authenticate()** to start authentication and the login screen is displayed.
trans-unit.target: This calls **Authenticate()** to start authentication and the login screen is displayed.

trans-unit.source: After you have successfully authenticated, the app displays the list of todo items and you can make updates to the data.
trans-unit.target: After you have successfully authenticated, the app displays the list of todo items and you can make updates to the data.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In the next tutorial, [Service-side authorization of Mobile Services users][Authorize users with scripts], you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In the next tutorial, [Service-side authorization of Mobile Services users][Authorize users with scripts], you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
